verses.verse: The burden <WH4853> of Nineveh. <WH5210> The book <WH5612> of the vision <WH2377> of Nahum <WH5151> the Elkoshite. <WH512>

God <WH410> is jealous, <WH7072> and the LORD <WH3068> revenges; <WH5358> the LORD <WH3068> revenges, <WH5358> and is furious; <WH1167> <WH2534> the LORD <WH3068> will take vengeance <WH5358> on his adversaries, <WH6862> and he reserves <WH5201> wrath for his enemies. <WH341>

The LORD <WH3068> is slow <WH750> to anger, <WH639> and great <WH1431> in power, <WH3581> and will not at all acquit <WH5352> the wicked: the LORD <WH3068> has his way <WH1870> in the whirlwind <WH5492> and in the storm, <WH8183> and the clouds <WH6051> are the dust <WH80> of his feet. <WH7272>

He rebukes <WH1605> the sea, <WH3220> and makes it dry, <WH3001> and dries <WH2717> up all <WH3605> the rivers: <WH5104> Bashan <WH1316> languishes, <WH535> and Carmel, <WH3760> and the flower <WH6525> of Lebanon <WH3844> languishes. <WH535>

The mountains <WH2022> quake <WH7493> at him, and the hills <WH1389> melt, <WH4127> and the earth <WH776> is burned <WH5375> at his presence, <WH6440> yes, the world, <WH8398> and all <WH3605> that dwell <WH3427> therein.

Who <WH4310> can stand <WH5975> before <WH6440> his indignation? <WH2195> and who <WH4310> can abide <WH6965> in the fierceness <WH2740> of his anger? <WH639> his fury <WH2534> is poured <WH5413> out like fire, <WH784> and the rocks <WH6697> are thrown <WH5422> down <WH5422> by him.
The LORD <WH3068> is good, <WH2896> a strong <WH4581> hold <WH4581> in the day <WH3117> of trouble; <WH6869> and he knows <WH3045> them that trust <WH2620> in him.
But with an overrunning <WH5674> flood <WH7858> he will make <WH6213> an utter <WH3617> end <WH3615> of the place <WH4725> thereof, and darkness <WH2822> shall pursue <WH7291> his enemies. <WH341>
What <WH4100> do you imagine <WH2803> against <WH413> the LORD? <WH3068> he will make <WH6213> an utter <WH3617> end: <WH3615> affliction <WH6869> shall not rise <WH6965> up the second time. <WH6471>

For while <WH5704> they be entwined <WH5440> together as thorns, <WH5518> and while they are drunken <WH5435> as drunkards, <WH5435> they shall be devoured <WH398> as stubble <WH7179> fully <WH4390> dry. <WH3002>
There is one come <WH3318> out of you, that imagines <WH2803> evil <WH7451> against <WH5921> the LORD, <WH3068> a wicked <WH1100> counselor. <WH3289>

Thus <WH3541> said <WH559> the LORD; <WH3068> Though <WH518> they be quiet, <WH8003> and likewise <WH3651> many, <WH7227> yet thus <WH3651> shall they be cut <WH1494> down, when he shall pass <WH5674> through. Though I have afflicted <WH6031> you, I will afflict <WH6031> you no <WH3808> more. <WH5750>
For now <WH6258> will I break <WH7665> his yoke <WH4132> from off <WH5921> you, and will burst <WH5423> your bonds <WH4147> in sunder.

And the LORD <WH3068> has given a commandment <WH6680> concerning <WH5921> you, that no <WH3808> more <WH5750> of your name <WH8034> be sown: <WH2232> out of the house <WH1004> of your gods <WH430> will I cut <WH3772> off the graven <WH6459> image <WH6755> and the molten <WH4541> image: <WH6755> I will make <WH7760> your grave; <WH6913> for you are vile. <WH7043>

Behold <WH2009> on the mountains <WH2022> the feet <WH7272> of him that brings <WH1319> good <WH1319> tidings, <WH1319> that publishes <WH8085> peace! <WH7965> O Judah, <WH3063> keep <WH2287> your solemn <WH2282> feasts, <WH2282> perform <WH7999> your vows: <WH5088> for the wicked <WH1100> shall no <WH3808> more <WH3254> <WH5750> pass <WH5674> through you; he is utterly <WH3605> cut <WH3772> off.
